text.0:
These journalists have just wrapped up a two-week #factchecking fellowship at our @AfricaCheck_Fr office in #Dakar, Senegal. 

They share what they’ve learned and how they will incorporate it into their work. https://t.co/qHEh24OqJO
text.1:
The fact checking training workshop to address and counter disinformation challenges on social media platforms during the Covid-19 pandemic in Kenya for  journalists, bloggers, and online influencers is happening today and tomorrow @AfricaCheck 

See you at there! Let's get facts https://t.co/WC2GfySi2A
text.2: Our three day training for Journalist in cooperation with @dwAkademie and @KASonline continues. Today on day two they hear from @AfricaCheck about their work. https://t.co/FGWrFCyZCl
text.3:
"If the story sounds too good, shocking or unlikely to be true, it is probably false" - Check it! 

I am thrilled to be part of the Fact Check Workshop courtesy of @AfricaCheck! Today was fun with @ayeshakajee & @anieshabulbulia. :hugging_face::hugging_face: https://t.co/bVrzglgClY
text.4: MSR and @AfricaCheck are conducting a fact-checking workshop in Mauritius for the youth. https://t.co/pO0q6QPl05
text.5:
:nerd_face: What do you know about crime and justice in Africa? 

Take our quiz and find out: https://t.co/UXwmB2Vs3x  

True or false? Boko Haram ranked as the deadliest terrorist group in the world in 2019.
